1354640511.given_title: BBC Radio 4 - The Reith Lectures, Patricia Williams: The Genealogy of Race:

1354743366.excerpt: Professor Patricia Williams examines how the issue of colour remains so powerfully determinative of everything in a world that is, by and large, officially `colour blind'. This year's Reith lecturer is Professor Patricia Williams, one of the most well known intellectuals in American law.

2087938385.resolved_title: Infrastructural Ecology: The City’s Buried Systems

3150919197.given_title: We All Know Christ’s Dying Words. But Can We Define the ‘It’ That Is ‘Finis
3150919197.resolved_title: We All Know Christ’s Dying Words. But Can We Define the ‘It’ That Is ‘Finished’?
3150919197.excerpt: One of the most famous lines in Scripture is also one of the most puzzling. We all know that Jesus, as he was dying, uttered the triumphant words “It is finished” (John 19:30). We quote it all the time. We celebrate it in our songs and our sermons.
